function.name: get_weather
function.description: Find weather for a given location and date and time, if no date and time is provide use the current date and time.

location.description: The location for the weather conditions.

date.description: The location for the weather conditions.

function.name: get_current_datetime
function.description: Get the current date and time.

function.name: start_workflow
function.description: Starts a workflow process, it requires the name of the workflow, workflow_name. The result will be a Task object containing instructions that you should follow and additional input that you can use to complete the task. The task object will contain the task_id, the task_name, task_instructions, and a conditions object. Evaluate each statement in the conditions object and create a corresponding `decisions` object with the same keys as the conditions object and boolean vlaues representing your responses to the statements in the conditions object.

workflow_name.description: This is the name of the workflow to start. It must be a valid workflow name.

input.description: This is the input to the workflow.

function.name: start_task
function.description: Starts a task associated with a workflow process. The result will contain instructions that you should follow and additional input that you can use to complete the task. The task object will contain the task_id, the task_name, task_instructions, until all task a complete.

task_name.description: This is the name of the task to start.

input.description: This is the input to the task.

function.name: complete_task
function.description: Completes a task associated with a workflow process, after following the instructions provided when you started a Task, provide your response to this tool..

task_id.description: This is the unique ID of the task to complete.

input.description: This is the input to the task to be completed.

decisions.description: This is a json object, where the keys correspond to the keys from the `conditions` object from the Task, and the values are Boolean (TRUE or FALSE) responses to the statements in the `conditions` object from the Task.

function.name: make_decision
function.description: Once you have completed the instruction, if the task has `conditions`, you will need to evaluate each condition and then call the `make_decision` tool with a TRUE or FALSE value for each named condition.

task_id.description: This is the unique ID of the task to complete.

decision_name.description: The name of the decision corresponding to the name of the condition used to make this decision.

function.name: remember
function.description: Creates a memory with a name and a value, the value is either a string or a JSON serializable object with attributes representing the attributes of the memory. For example, create_memory('home_address', "{'city': 'San Francisco', 'state': 'CA', 'zip': '94105'})"

value.description: This mandatory field must contain a string represeenting the value of the memory or a complete and valid JSON object with all the required details of the memory to be created, as specified by the user.

name.description: The name of the memory to create. It must be a unique identifier within the memory collection and using the name name as a previous memory will update the value of that memory.

function.name: recall_memories
function.description: Recalls all memories related to the current user.

function.name: forget_memory
function.description: Forgets a memory by its name.

memory_name.description: The name of the memory to delete.
